Comments: Static block starting at 0x80453080 for P1, 80453F10 for P2, 80454dA0 for P3, 80455C30 for P4
Short. 0x0001 for normal, 0x0100 for transformed (Probably Zelda/Sheik only)
Functional Explanations / Notes: 800326CC multiplies 1 * 0x0C if a character is transformed. So the formula for position = 0x10 + (0x0C * isTransformed), resulting in positions offsets 0x1C through 0x24 instead of 0x10 through 0x18

Comments: Float. Set by initial spawn & respawns. If you're transformed, this acts as the player nametag position.
Float. These are set the first time you respawn, unless a stage changes your spawn position
Float. Same as Spawn Position Z.
Byte. 00 = normal, 01 = red, 02 = blue, 03 = green (reflected in icon immediately)
Float. Scale that match was started with. Modifying does nothing.

Effect: Stamina HP Lost / Percentage - Currently Displayed

Comments: Short. Used in modes like Sudden Death to set your starting Percentage. Otherwise Nana's or Sheik's %
Int. If -1 in zz_0035184, then it's set to MatchInfo->frame_count
Int. Incremented every time you move the joystick a different direction from neutral.
Used for followers, such as Nana

Effect: Stale Move Table Current Write Index
Comments: Int. Zero-Indexed. Rolls over after 9. Increments after each write.
2nd Short is the # of action states that character has gone through this game
Int. Incremented by 1 with each attack, hit or miss
Int. Incremented when an attack lands
Float. Reflects the highest amount of damage received in a single life
Refers to values starting from the "data pointer," also known as a GObj
Byte. Index into 2 arrays (highest render priority & lowest) of various GObjs for rendering, essentially indicating object type.
Byte. Set to 0xFF for NO REF.
Byte. Set to 0xFF for NO REF.
Data pointers are "daisy-chained," so each subsequent player is accessed from the data pointer of the previous
For P2+, this points to P(n - 1)

Effect: Next player's data pointer - GX Ordered
Comments: This points to the lower render priority GObj relative to this one.

Effect: Previous player's data pointer - GX Ordered
Comments: This points to the higher render priority GObj relative to this one.

Effect: Pointer to Player Character Data (see below table)
Comments: Usually 0x60 away from the start of Player Entity Struct
Traditionally, the game points to this for anything related to Char Data, as sometimes the data does not immediately follow the entity struct
Points back to 0x00 of the Entity
Word. Used for bone lookups, such as prior to spawning JObjs at a specified bone
The current life is the nth character spawned since the beginning of the match
The value at this address indicates the action state of the character. Modifying this alone does nothing.
The animation to occur after the current one ends. Only has an effect if the current action state is set to loop.
Not a direct repeat of above. I believe 0x30 is the actual facing direction of the model / Bone 0, and 0x2C is the "official" character facing as far as game/move logic is concerned.
Read on map load. Set according to 0x94. Affects physics. [Affects hitbox size?]
Read on map load. Changes width on Z-Axis
Traditionally 0x00000000. THIS IS NOT ALWAYS CONSISTENT

Effect: Pointer to 0x40 / Pointer to Prev Linked List

Comments: Changing this will only have an effect if the character is in the air.
Float. Positive = up, negative = down. Changes when the player jumps/falls of his own accord. Does not kill upward.
Float. Positive = up, negative = down. Only works when player is in the air. Changes when the player is attacked. Kills upward.
Float. Positive is right, negative is left. 00000000 is center.
Float. Only works when player is in the air.
0x00000000 on ground, 0x00000001 in air. Changing does nothing.

Effect: Horzitonal Velocity Queue (Will be added to 0xEC)

Comments: Float. Self-induced. Also affects running animation.

0x8 from the address located here contains a pointer to the start of the .dat (0x20 of the start of the .dat in RAM)
0x44 from the address located here contains a pointer to ledge grab box values. 0x10,014,0x18 are ledge grab box values
These values are taken from the dat files and loaded directly into memory.

Effect: Ground to air jump momentum multiplier
Frames to change direction on standing turn

Comments: Used by functions that are checking Article FP data
(Start of subaction struct. Often referenced as a pointer in subaction event functions as r4)
Float, resets to 1 with each new action state.

Pointer. Pointer points to the current position of the subaction event data (by the Word) as it is being read by the subaction event handler. The subaction event data is as it is stored in the Pl**.dat file. (That's right, like in Crazy Hand)
Byte. Change to 0x80 or above to induce a color tint. Melee uses 0x91
I THINK this points to data related to current action state.
Most-significant bit appears to be related to air-to-ground momentum transfer, rest unknown

Effect: Pointer to portion of PlxxAJ.dat for current subaction
Bone lookup table (Points to a table of pointers to JObjs)
Functional Explanations / Notes: Note: The Table1 referenced here is incorrect - It's actually a JObj.

Comments: Byte. Change this to have a different player control the character.
Used to compare previous value vs. current value to differentiate "tilts" and "smashes"
See Global Addresses regarding Controller Data to better understand this.

Effect: Frames Analog Stick Has Been in Tilt (X-Axis)
Frames Analog Stick Has Been in Tilt (Y-Axis)
Frames Analog Trigger Has Been Lightly Pressed
Frames Analog Stick Has Been in SmashTurn or Tilt (X-Axis)
Frames Analog Stick Has Been in SmashTurn or Tilt (Y-Axis)
Frames Analog Trigger Has Been Hard Pressed
Frames Since Analog Stick Was Moved From X-Axis
Frames Since Analog Stick Was Moved From Y-Axis
Frames Since Analog Trigger Was Moved
Frames Since A Button Was Pressed
Frames Since B Button Was Pressed
Frames Since X/Y Button Was Pressed
Frames Since Z Button Was Pressed
Frames Since L/R Digital Button Was Pressed
Frames Since DPad Up Button Was Pressed
Frames Since DPad Down Button Was Pressed
Time since Special Button being pressed (not modifiable?)
Comments: Modified in function at 0x8006abec; is based on the bool return value of a function pertaining to the B button. Byte. (0=just pressed; n = pressed n frames ago)

Effect: Unk (Y Offset from Double Jump position?)
Comments: Float. Used for Peach, Mewtwo, Yoshi, Ness Jump calc.

Effect: Pointer to 0x00 / Start of Physics Struct

Comments: Float. Likely positions of TopN for physics related functions.
Byte. Default is 00, Pokemon Stadium transformations change this value
Float, resets to 1 with each new action state.
Float. Used for setting 0x3E8 during Event function
Knocks player out of action states when set to 40C00000
Note that the above thread lists as +0x60 position

For some reason there is a flag in the hitbox subaction event that, when combined with this address being zero, prevents said hitbox from spawning (The code literally makes the parser skip over the hitbox.). See 0x8007121c. // Makes an exception for hitbox collision?
Functional Explanations / Notes: Update: Pointer of the player who threw this character. Used for throw knockback collisions and enables hitboxes only when character is thrown.

Comments: Somethign to do with Hitboxes and friendly fire?
The byte at 0xC of the grabbing player's block is stored here for the person who was grabbed
Acts like Yoshi's Double Jump Armor. Works on Grounded and Aerial! Float.
Goes up by 1 for every frame in offscreen bubble
Float. Counts down by 1 every frame until reaching 0. The last frame of hitlag is the frame before it hits 0.
Read by the Walljump AS to determine how much velocity to give (800c2114)
Invincibility runs out when this hits 0. Modifiable.
Invincibility runs out when this hits 0. Modifiable.
Float. 1 is hard shield. z-shield is 3D924921, or .071429
Float. Grabs, sleep attack element, ground attack element. Player breaks out when this reaches 0.
Short. Set according to r4 in 8007e2d0
Short. Set according to r4 by 8007e2f4
Int. Lower 8 bits is the type. Can be changed mid-game.
Frames of Lip Stick Flower remaining
Controls something with the duration of the sparkle after starman ends.
(32-bit) After obtaining a either mushroom, default length gets stored in this address and is decremented by one every frame. Transforms back to regular size when reaches 0.
Decrements by 1 each frame off the ledge
Increases by 1 with every new action state until match end.

Effect: Word from 0x4 of Move Logic Table
Comments: 8-Bit (is read in bits, but is stored with a word @ 8008968c (comes from action state change))
Byte. Seems to have something to do with how the Sakurai angle is calculated. See 0x8007ac9c.
Displays the "P1", etc. tag when the countdown hits 1.
These are part of some sort of linked list. The next value after pointers always seems to be 6.
Set to 0 when contact with a wall (other conditions necessary)
2 = charging smash, 3 = attacking with charged smash, 0 = all other times

Effect: Frame number at which a fully charged smash initiates (float)
Functional Explanations / Notes: This isn't accurate for Fox. For him, it's a pointer to 0x2124. So, this is likely some kind of struct that needs to be better understood.

Effect: Charged smash attack animation speed multiplier (attack animation only)

Comments: Int. Some kind of timer. Seems to count down on attacks and up during states like Wait

Effect: Current Action State IASA Function Pointer
Current Action State Animation Interrupt Pointer
Current Action State Collision Interrupt Pointer
Current Action State Camera Behavior Pointer

Comments: 800E1178 is an example of this being set for Mario's Special N.

Effect: Pointer to function to execute on-hit
Comments: Used by Link/YL dair and possibly others. Works for any grounded or aerial normal, but it seems not to be evaluated for specials.

Effect: Function to run on Shield Hit
Function to run on Reflect Hit
Function to run when player is hit
Function to run when player leaves hitlag
Function to run when player is hit
Function to run when player is thrown
Comments: Function is run after kirby Up-Throw hit's the ground. blrl for this exists at 80069bd8 inside ActionStateChange

Effect: Function to run when white detection bubbles collide

Comments: 01=no collision bubbles (default), 02=collision bubbles & no char textures, 03=overlayed bubbles
Int. Checked == 0 in 800e4f48 and set to 0 if != 0
Checked for Mario Cape @ 800e1668, equals 1 when reflect hitbox should be active // Used during Fox/Falco's Shine at 800e65bc
Compared with 2 during Fox/Falco's shine at 800e65bc
Byte. Mario's fireball spawn (800E0EE0) checks bit 24 == 1
Byte. Checked and modified with 80093bc0 and 80093cd0. 0x80 = IASA enabled. Set by 80071950 (Subaction 0x5C)

Byte. 0x05 = character freezes and hitboxes stay out for 1 collision. 0x03 = player acts normal and freezes when hit, can SDI around after. (verify: 0x10 = hitbox is out?) [0x01 bit appears to be the flag that controls whether or not the hitboxes of the character can have  collisions.]
Byte. Bit 31 checked and modified with 80093bc0 and 80093cd0
Byte. Get bit 24 with 80086B64. Get bit 28 with 800874BC. Get bit 29 with 8008730C.

Effect: Misc Flags // Bowser Flame Degradation Count // Marth Side B Refresh // Peach Float // Luigi Cyclone Flag
Comments: Compared to 0 for transitioning to Action State 14 during Fox/Falco Shine @ 800e65bc, is also expected to be 0 prior in the function // Peach Float Flag reset @ (0x80069934)
Used as a check in DrMario's pill spawn function @ 0x800E0FD0 as an index for the current pill color

Functional Explanations / Notes: When Peach's Parasol is removed by 802BDB94, this is swapped into the Held Item. Presumably for when Up-Bing with an Item

Comments: Appears to be a value or duration of sorts. See @0x800768a0

Directly related to Hitbox.0x04. When creating a hitbox, if what that value gets set to is equal to the value in this memory address, it will trigger a function that copies unknown parts of the hitbox.See @0x800768a0
Used for Kirby's vertical velocity boost on side B.Reset to 0 when
Functional Explanations / Notes: Also used to count other things relating to frames (but as integers): Shield Time, Grabbed Time, Time Left on Spawn Platform, Time left to lie on Ground
Also used to count other things relating to frames (but as integers): Shield Time, Grabbed Time, Time Left on Spawn Platform, Time left to lie on Ground

Effect: Misc Flags // Hitstun counter // Short Hop Identifier // PS Count
Comments: Float. Frames of hitstun left. Decremented by 1 every frame of game. // 0 = full hop, 1 = short hop
Byte. Used for flags, like Cliff Grab.

Effect: Misc Flags // Shield Location from Body
Comments: Float. 0 = center of body, 1 = furthest amount away
Float, degrees. 0 = in front of, 90 = up, 180 = behind, 270 = down (offset +10 degrees?)
Float. Used to calclulate landing lag. Dividend is usually 30, so 30 divided by this value gives you the number the animation speed will be DIVIDED by. Quotient smaller numbers = longer animation

Read upon landing at 80096d68 and compared at 800d5db0. If 0, cannot act out of landing. If 1, can act out of landing after 4 frames. (Used to differentiate between a specialland and normal land?) // OLD DESCRIPTION: Float. Used for a comparison @ 80093c94 and 80093cd0

Effect: Start of Per Character Article Floating Points
Comments: Doesn't appear to be 1:1 with Dantarion's offsets, but mostly the same. Not all changes work. Plus they reset whenever a new spawn of the character occurs.
